metadata.title: CVE-2017-6438 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the parse_unicode_node function in bplist.cin libimobiledevice libplist 1.12 allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds write) and possibly code execution via a craftedplist file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplist++3v5 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist-utils - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
libplist3 - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
python-plist - 1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libplist package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12+git+1+e37ca00-0.3').
